newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy govt sees no change in alliance over welfare.
newsitem.headline: Italy govt sees no change in alliance over welfare.

text.p: Italian Deputy Prime Minister Walter Veltroni said on Thursday the centre-left government would succeed in reforming social spending without having to make any changes to its ruling alliance.
"Welfare reform must be done by this (ruling) majority," Veltroni told reporters when asked about the next big battleground in Italian politics.
Prime Minister Romano Prodi's year-old government relies on support from the hard-left Communist Refoundation party for a majority in the lower house of parliament.
But Refoundation is vehemently opposed to any cuts in social spending and has made clear it will not give in to what it calls "the mother of all issues" even if Prodi is in difficulty.
Asked what would happen if the government should fail to pull off the overdue reform of the welfare state with the current ruling alliance, Veltroni said: "We will succeed."
